Coordinating charitable giving with tax brackets

sections.title: Think in Buckets
sections.content: Divide assets into taxable, tax-deferred, and tax-free buckets. Optimizing contribution and withdrawal order across these buckets can save thousands over a lifetime.

points.title: Roth Conversions
points.description: Convert pre-tax assets during low-income years to lock in lower rates and reduce future RMDs.

points.title: Tax-Loss Harvesting
points.description: Offset gains by realizing losses in taxable accounts while maintaining market exposure.

points.title: Charitable Clumping
points.description: Bunch multiple years of donations into one year to exceed itemization thresholds.

sections.title: Mind Wash-Sale Rules
sections.content: When harvesting losses, avoid buying substantially identical securities 30 days before or after the sale.

sections.title: Tax Coordination Checklist
steps: List accounts by tax treatment and note contribution/withdrawal limits.
Identify years with lower income to plan Roth conversions or capital gain realizations.
Schedule semiannual portfolio reviews to harvest losses and rebalance.
Map charitable goals and decide whether donor-advised funds or appreciated stock gifts fit best.
Consult a tax professional annually to align tactics with changing laws.
